Display Wrapped Curve Data

Display curve values which are outside of the specified scale range.

On the Curves tab, select Curve Settings. The Curve Settings dialog box will open.

Select the Curve, then Close the list.

On the Display tab, open the Legend node.

Choose the Wrapping (Backup) Action.

Truncate if you do not want to display curve values that are outside of the specified range.

Wrap Left if you want the curve values that are outside of the right edge of the track to be wrapped around on the same track.

Wrap Right if you want the curve values that are outside of the left edge of the track to be wrapped around on the same track.

None if you want to display the entire range of curve data although it falls outside the scale range. There is no wrap or truncate action. The curve values that fall outside the track edge will be plotted as if the track covered the entire width of the plot.

Display a legend for the wrapped curve by ticking Display Backup Curve Legend.

Select Apply to implement the changes.

Note. The infinite wrapping is limited by the Maximum number of times to Wrap a Curve in the Other tab in Global Settings.
